html:
The Canon PowerShot V1 has been written about a lot recently and we figured we’d put all of the information we have in one place. There is some new information about the upcoming camera.

The announcement for the Canon PowerShot V1 will be a bit different than normal. It looks like it will be a sort of development announcement. Canon Japan will announce the camera before CP+, which begins in a couple of weeks, with a full announcement coming some time in March.

We think pretty much everything about the camera will be released before CP+, so it’s not really a standard development announcement. This seems like a new way to launch a camera from Canon, but something could have been lost in translation.

We’re told that the Canon PowerShot V1 will have a launch price of $899 USD. We do not have pricing in any other currency at this time. The pricing doesn’t shock us considering the larger sensor size for a compact camera.

We have also been told that there will be a whole line of accessories for the PowerShot V1, though we do not have a list of what to expect. It’ll probably the usual sort of stuff and there will likely be a “creator” bundle launched at some point.

Both the PowerShot G7 X Mark III and PowerShot SX70 HS will be discontinued in the first half of 2025, so we expect the PowerShot V1 to hit the market some time in March or April of this year.

Canon may also show one or two “concept” PowerShot cameras at CP+.

Canon PowerShot V1 Specifications (Rumored)

  • 24MP CMOS (Canon Made)
  • 1.4″ 3:2 Sensor
  • DIGIC X Series
  • DPAF
  • Multi-Function Shoe
  • Approximently 16-50mm (35mm Equivalent)
  • 3″ LCD (1 Million Pixels)
  • Articulating Screen
  • 4K Video (Slight crop for aspect ratio)
  • 4K 60P / 1080 120P (Unconfirmed)
  • Vertical Video Capable
  • New Streaming Features (No detailed information)
  • RAW, C-RAW, Dual Pixel RAW
  • H.265 / HEVC
  • C-Log 3 / HDR PQ
  • A full line of accessories
  • February/March 2025
  • Price: $899 USD
